channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The longest government shutdown in history is over—but flights and jobs data won’t return to normalcy yet
item.description: The House passed a bill last night to fund the government through Jan. 30, and President Trump signed it, reopening the federal government.

item.title: BofA cites ‘favorable protein economics’ in the chicken restaurant segment with the race afoot to corner the $67 billion market
item.description: Analysts Sara Senatore and Isaiah Austin also highlighted "menu versatility," as chicken lends itself to both quick-service restaurants and fast casua...

item.title: MacKenzie Scott makes more ‘life-changing,’ record-breaking gifts to historically Black colleges and universities—totaling more than $400 million
item.description: These donations come on the heels of other major donations from Scott to HBCUs this fall.

item.title: Self-made millionaire Barbara Corcoran reveals her ‘golden rule’ of real estate investing
item.description: The “Shark Tank” star with a $100 million net worth says paying 20% down is key—and explains why.

item.title: In just 15 years, the average U.S. homebuyer went from 39 to 59 years old: Top analyst reveals how the housing market has warped in one generation
item.description: The first-time homebuyer just hit 40 years old for the first time ever, but the average homebuyer is nearly a senior citizen.

item.title: Stock-market pause in cards after four-day, 1,350-point Dow surge — live updates
Here’s how stocks weathered the government shutdown
401(k) contribution limits for 2026 have just been made public
We might never see the October jobs report, says Trump press secretary
Economic calendar: Data releases to play catch-up as federal government reopens
